poem:
### Awakening

In Salisbury's hushed ward,  
shadowed with novichok air,  
Yulia stirs – a rustle  
of sheets, disbelief breaking.  
Gobsmacked eyes meet hers,  
crying through the fog – fear  
undone by whispered promises.  
The consultant's touch, a tether,  
unsure hand in the unknown,  
yet holding strong to morning's  
thin, healing light.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Consultant who treated Yulia Skripal ‘gobsmacked’ when she woke up, inquiry hears A hospital consultant who treated Sergei and Yulia Skripal after they were poisoned with the nerve agent novichok was “gobsmacked” when Yulia woke and began trying to get out of bed four days after the attack. Dr Stephen Cockroft said he tried to reassure Yulia, who was “crying and terrified”, that she was safe and also asked her if anyone had attacked her". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
